title: A Reporter's Life in Russia
summary: Steve Rosenberg is a BBC reporter who lives in Russia. He has worked there for over 30 years and loves the country's culture. But things changed when Russia invaded Ukraine in 2022. Now, it is harder for him to report the news because of new laws that limit what people can say. Some Russian TV hosts call him an enemy, which makes him sad. He has to be very careful to tell the truth without getting into trouble. This article shows what it is like to be a journalist in Russia during a war.

background_read: This article is about a BBC reporter named Steve Rosenberg who works in Russia. He has been there for many years and enjoys Russian culture. After Russia invaded Ukraine in 2022, the government made new laws that make it risky for journalists to report news. Steve has to be careful to avoid trouble while telling true stories. Some people on Russian TV say mean things about him, which shows how tense things are.
